intro: Psychotria fulva, commonly known as the yellow psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are often consumed by various bird species. Psychotria fulva is also known for its mild psychoactive properties due to the presence of certain alkaloids.
